letters.description: Explore the counselee's presenting issues, spiritual beliefs, and relational history to establish a baseline understanding.
Build rapport through empathy, active listening, and demonstrating genuine care and acceptance, fostering a safe and trusting environment.
Facilitate self-discovery through biblical principles and insightful questions, helping the counselee gain a deeper understanding of their challenges and God's perspective.
Collaboratively develop practical, biblically-sound action steps and strategies to address the root causes of the issues and promote lasting positive change.
Support the counselee in establishing new, healthy habits and thought patterns grounded in faith, leading to sustained growth and a renewed sense of hope and purpose.
